message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the development of neuromorphic electronic circuits for building autonomous cognitive systems. The focus is on emulating neural and synaptic dynamics, implementing spike-based plasticity mechanisms, and implementing working-memory and decision-making mechanisms. These topics are all related to the field of neuromorphic engineering, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses the challenges of realizing these circuits in physical systems, which could fall under the category of cs.ET (Emerging Technologies). Additionally, the paper discusses the computational properties of recurrent neural networks and their implementation in hardware, which could fall under the categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper discusses the use of these circuits for building autonomous cognitive systems, which could fall under the category of cs.SY (Systems and Control).
